intro: Zehneria indica, commonly known as the Indian zehneria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly rough texture. Zehneria indica is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and fragrant blooms.
